meanings.definition: A person or thing that supersedes.
meanings.sent1: The new technology quickly became the superseders of the old methods.
meanings.sent2: The superseders in the office were the young, innovative employees.
meanings.sent3: The superseders, the shiny new robots, took over the factory floor with their efficiency.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, trends are the superseders of last season's styles.
meanings.sent5: The superseders, like a wave washing away the sandcastles, brought change to the industry.

meanings.sent1: The museum displayed various artifacts, including ancient superseders of rulers.
meanings.sent2: The superseders of the old regime were now seen as relics of the past.
meanings.sent3: At the costume party, the group dressed as superseders of historical figures.
meanings.sent4: The shelves were filled with books, each one a superseders of knowledge and ideas.
meanings.sent5: The garden was a collection of superseders, each plant outshining the other in beauty.
